moves.1. e4: This is my sixth annotation. e4 is the common opening move.Opens up a lot of opportunities for the main pieces to break free.
moves.1... e6: e6 - a new defence to me. Unfortunately I am unsure of what it is called.
moves.2. e5: So I try something new myself.
moves.2... a6: An interesting move as it benefits none of black's pieces.
moves.3... b5: Another pawn move. No major pieces have come into play yet.
moves.4. c3: Here too, I am not benefiting any pieces and restraining my knight.
moves.4... Bb7: The bishop comes out for the side attack.
moves.5. Nf3: The knight comes out for the block.
moves.6. Bd3: Not allowing the rook to come out.
moves.6... g5: Comes out to attack the knight with g5.
moves.7. g4: Risky move, leaving the queen to protect the knight.
moves.7... f5: Trying to make sure I can't escape and closing the knight in.
moves.8. gxf5 g4: There. I accidentally move the knight which was blocking my rook.
moves.10... h5 11. Qg6+: Black's king is stuck after some realisation.
moves.12. Bg5+ Nf6 13. Bxf6#: That's it! Thanks to monty66 for a great game.
